pr_title: GH-600: add short answer for deserialization-errors KT

timeline.message: GH-600: add short answer for deserialization-errors KT

timeline.bodyText: Do we want a title for short answers? We have "short answers" that use the title section (Idempotent producer & Masking Data) and one that doesn't (Anomaly Detection). I personally don't love that the title text appears to be in a larger font size than "Short Answer" and find that a title can be redundant given the nature of this section. Thoughts @ybyzek?
timeline.author: awalther28

replies.bodyText:
@awalther28

I personally don't love that the title text appears to be in a larger font size than "Short Answer"

💯 agree with the font issue.  I actually spent some time trying to tweak the font size for the first short answer example, but was unsuccessful.
For clarity: are you saying you like this approach (as the PR Is now) and we should standardize on this for all short answers?
replies.author: ybyzek

replies.bodyText:
@ybyzek glad to hear I'm not the only one to notice the font size difference. Thank you for looking into if we can change that :) I like this approach of omitting a title and would like to see future KT short answers do the same.
I could be convinced to standardize adding a title if we can change the font size + the title provides value.
replies.author: awalther28

replies.bodyText: My preference would be to have no title, so I'd take the PR as it stands now.  But I don't have a strong opinion, so I could go with a title (assuming we work out the font sizing)—just my 2 cents.
replies.author: bbejeck

replies.bodyText:
One more advantage to having no title is that special characters can be added to adoc that can't be added to the title.  For example, KSQL_PROCESSING_LOG can have backticks (and thus special formatting), ONLY if it's in adoc, not title
`KSQL_PROCESSING_LOG`

So the advantages of no title are:

Easy, done, no more fiddling with font size manipulation
Special characters.

Disadvantage:

The yml file looks "funny"?

If we agree with no title, which I think we do...here's an audit:
aggregating-count/ksql.yml:answer:
aggregating-count/ksql.yml-  steps:

--

--
anomaly-detection/ksql.yml:answer:

--
console-consumer-producer-basic/kafka.yml:answer:
console-consumer-producer-basic/kafka.yml-  steps:
console-consumer-producer-basic/kafka.yml-    - title: Console producer
--
deserialization-errors/ksql.yml:answer:
deserialization-errors/ksql.yml-  steps:
deserialization-errors/ksql.yml-    - title:
--
masking-data/ksql.yml:answer:

--
message-ordering/kafka.yml:answer:

So I could update this PR to fix all the KTs that use titles, and move it to adocs.  @awalther28 @bbejeck  please let me know if you agree, and I'll jump on it ;)
